articles.headline: The Fed’s QE2 Traders, Buying Bonds by the Billions
articles.snippet: The traders are buying hundreds of billions of dollars of United States Treasury securities on the open market in a controversial attempt to keep interest rates low and revive the economy.
articles.abstract: The traders are buying hundreds of billions of dollars of United States Treasury securities on the open market in a controversial attempt to keep interest rates low and revive the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Deep inside the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, the $600 billion man is fast at work.

articles.headline: In Tucson, Guns Have a Broad Constituency
articles.snippet: Representative Gabrielle Giffords once boasted: “I have a Glock 9 mm and I’m a pretty good shot,” highlighting a passionate gun culture that crosses political lines.
articles.abstract: Representative Gabrielle Giffords once boasted: “I have a Glock 9 mm and I’m a pretty good shot,” highlighting a passionate gun culture that crosses political lines.
articles.lead_paragraph: TUCSON — “I have a Glock 9 millimeter, and I’m a pretty good shot.”
articles.byline: By Jo Becker and Michael Luo

articles.headline: Pakistan Faces a Divide of Age on Muslim Law
articles.snippet: The same young lawyers once seen as a force for democracy are now rallying behind the confessed killer of a provincial governor.
articles.abstract: The same young lawyers once seen as a force for democracy are now rallying behind the confessed killer of a provincial governor.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Cheering crowds have gathered in recent days to support the assassin who riddled the governor of Punjab with 26 bullets and to praise his attack  carried out in the name of the Prophet Muhammad  as an act of heroism. To the surprise of many, chief among them have been Pakistan’s young lawyers, once seen as a force for democracy.

articles.headline: A Resurgent Chrysler Says It Is Here to Stay
articles.snippet: Chrysler is in the midst of a new-product blitz that includes revamped models, as well as smaller models it will get from Fiat.
articles.abstract: Chrysler is in the midst of a new-product blitz that includes revamped models, as well as smaller models it will get from Fiat.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  A year ago, Chrysler didn’t have a single new vehicle to display at its hometown auto show, and rival executives were taking bets on how long the smallest and most troubled of Detroit’s three automakers would last.

articles.headline: Judges Berate Bank Lawyers in Foreclosures
articles.snippet: In many opinions, judges have accused lawyers of processing shoddy or even fabricated paperwork in foreclosure actions when representing banks.
articles.abstract: In many opinions, judges have accused lawyers of processing shoddy or even fabricated paperwork in foreclosure actions when representing banks.
articles.lead_paragraph: With judges looking ever more critically at home foreclosures, they are reaching beyond the bankers to heap some of their most scorching criticism on the lawyers.

articles.headline: In Giffords’s District, a Long History of Tension
articles.snippet: The 8th Congressional District of Arizona, which shares a border with Mexico, is one of the most polarized in the nation.
articles.abstract: The 8th Congressional District of Arizona, which shares a border with Mexico, is one of the most polarized in the nation.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article was reported by Sam Dolnick, Katharine Q. Seelye and  Adam Nagourney and written by Mr. Nagourney.
articles.byline: By Sam Dolnick, Katharine Q. Seelye and Adam Nagourney

articles.headline: In Detroit, Toyota Vows to Earn Trust
articles.snippet: Akio Toyoda, Toyota’s president, made his first appearance at an American auto show, and said his company was committed to gaining the trust of consumers.
articles.abstract: Akio Toyoda, Toyota’s president, made his first appearance at an American auto show, and said his company was committed to gaining the trust of consumers.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  The auto show here this week is shaping up to be a celebration of the American car industry’s resurgence. But the appearance on Monday of Akio Toyoda, the Toyota president and grandson of the Japanese carmaker’s founder, was a reminder that the biggest foreign player in the American market is refusing to be counted out.

articles.headline: AT&T and Verizon Trade Taunts Over iPhone
articles.snippet: Verizon is set to offer an iPhone, cranking up the fight over smartphones, which generate substantial revenues.
articles.abstract: Verizon is set to offer an iPhone, cranking up the fight over smartphones, which generate substantial revenues.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the Verizon-AT&T fight, the gloves are officially off.

articles.headline: Test of Stealth Fighter Clouds Gates Visit to China
articles.snippet: A jet test was conducted only hours before Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates met with President Hu Jintao.
articles.abstract: A jet test was conducted only hours before Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates met with President Hu Jintao.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — China’s military conducted a test flight of a new stealth fighter jet on Tuesday, overshadowing an important visit to Beijing by Defense Secretary Robert M. Gates aimed at improving defense ties — and apparently catching China’s civilian leadership off guard.
articles.byline: By Elisabeth Bumiller and Michael Wines
